title: [Large-scale] Instructional Design Strategies for Innovating Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Science Education Knowledge and Digital Device Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Students, as novices with diverse background knowledge, require practical instructional design techniques immediately applicable in science education settings. Operating blended classes where online and offline learning activities are conducted in parallel in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment.

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more instructional design models (e.g., ADDIE, ARCS) suitable for science education environments according to situational needs
Learners incorporate science education trends (e.g., computational thinking, active learning) into instructional design based on bibliometric analysis results
Learners design and implement cognitive load management strategies in multimedia and blended learning environments

Trainees design assessment tools (quizzes: 5 questions, projects: 1 per team, discussions: 3 sessions per topic) for large-scale learners (over 100) in a blended learning environment (online platform + offline workshop) and achieve an effectiveness score of over 85 points through peer evaluation and expert review.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
